Sentencas: This paper describes a systematic method for developing model-based controllers for solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC) systems.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: To enhance the system efficiency and to avoid possible damages, the system must be controlled within specific operating conditions, while satisfying a load requirement.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: Model predictive control (MPC) is a natural choice for control implementation.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: However, to implement MPC, a low-order model is needed that captures the dominant dynamic behavior over the operating range.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: A linear parameter varying (LPV) model structure is developed and applied to obtain a control-oriented dynamic model of the SOFC stack.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: This approach effectively reduces a detailed physical model to a form that is compatible with MPC.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: The LPV structure includes nonlinear scheduling functions that blend the dynamics of locally linear models to represent nonlinear dynamic behavior over large operating ranges.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: Alternative scheduling variables are evaluated, with cell current being shown to be an appropriate choice.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: Using the reduced-order model, an MPC controller is designed that can respond to the load requirement over a wide range of operation changes while maintaining input-output variables within specified constraints.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control

Sentencas: To validate the approach, the LPV-based M PC controller is applied to the high-order physical model.
Titulo: Modeling and control of tubular solid-oxide fuel cell systems: II. Nonlinear model reduction and model predictive control
